flow.descriptionCdata:
a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.207fca42-4c2d-4af2-bc52-73924580238c.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.2989deb2-3656-410c-8e3c-a187d36a3059.description=
Multiplies two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The product of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.487eb953-2153-4fd3-8c17-cb1d37c6a8ba.prompt=Component ID a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.4dc97654-dc95-4c2c-b630-f5623d0f73f3.description=This workflow adds/ updates the component properties to Instance using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing properties no - To add and/or update properties keyValuePairs\: If you want to Add/update new properties\: property1 PUBLIC INTEGER 5 property2 PUBLIC STRING abc xyz If you want to only update the values of existing properties\: property1 5 property2 abc xyz a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.51bca852-2ce1-4c54-a780-5fd5865472c1.prompt=Artifact ID a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.51dc4585-6663-4f61-8642-0e7a9855ba82.prompt=Component ID a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.55e3fcca-163f-4522-a6b5-6a44e001f35b.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.589ded00-4b94-453e-9037-a6a8426bbc34.prompt=User Identifier a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.5e88d161-2939-4ff4-9720-2e7be6958115.description=This workflow adds/ updates the component properties to Instance using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing properties no - To add and/or update properties keyValuePairs\: If you want to Add/update new properties\: property1 PUBLIC INTEGER 5 property2 PUBLIC STRING abc xyz If you want to only update the values of existing properties\: property1 5 property2 abc xyz a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.87f0a0b2-09a0-459f-b0c6-e25b3b09661f.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.89f5463d-2dc5-46c3-b61f-82a030379369.prompt=Process Instance ID a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.979715e1-a3d6-480d-abd9-26927cc6b38b.prompt=User Identifier a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.a069f4f9-f95e-4e98-8eac-68acff177a34.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.b43d8549-a4ad-4817-a2dc-ca3e71fb1273.prompt=User Identifier a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.c4375aeb-0427-4ac7-8685-ded2e6a85e41.prompt=User Identifier a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.d7274ab9-667a-4856-bb57-fdb14929f560.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.e57560f1-4926-4e8a-bc16-643cd435cdaa.prompt=User Identifier a3f570be-adce-454c-af8a-d8d400bd7b16.f28ab5ec-4e6b-4a33-b1f0-b9a50635f5ff.prompt=Process Instance ID
flow.name: VPC - Modify T-shirt sizes

step.name: Send Mail to Support for T-Shirt Size

staticBinding.value:
Hi Team,

Please change the server ${Hostname}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain} t-shirt size.
Old tshirt size: ${oldCPU} CPU and ${oldMemory} MB RAM
New tshirt size: ${newCPU} CPU and ${newMemory} MB RAM
CSA ID: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID}.

When completed, please respond to the requestor notifying them.
Requestor Email: ${server.email}

Your MTC request to change to modify T-shirt size according to the below has been received.



Hostname: ${Hostname}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain}
Old T-shirt size: ${oldCPU} CPU and ${oldMemory} MB RAM
New T-shirt size: ${newCPU} CPU and ${newMemory} MB RAM
CSA ID: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID}



Please allow up to 24 hours forcompletion.

Regards,
The MTC Support Team
